channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Responsive WordPress Slider
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Responsive WordPress Slider

item.title: CVE-2021-24544|2024-08-03T19:35:20.162Z -- unknown -- responsive%20wordpress%20slider
item.description: The Responsive WordPress Slider WordPress plugin through 2.2.0 does not sanitise and escape some of the Slider options, allowing Cross-Site Scripting payloads to be set in them. Furthermore, as by default any authenticated user is allowed to create Sliders (https://wordpress.org/support/topic/slider-can-be-changed-from-any-user-even-subscriber/, such settings can be changed in the plugin's settings), this would allow user with a role as low as subscriber to perform Cross-Site Scripting attacks against logged in admins viewing the slider list and could lead to privilege escalation by creating a rogue admin account for example.
